intro: Michelia foveolata var. cinerascens, commonly known as the silver-veined Michelia, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The leaves are glossy and dark green, with a distinctive silvery-white vein pattern that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas with high humidity.
